page.title: 09Religion
page.content: Religious beliefs in Kennethmont are mainly Christian. The church in Kennethmont is Church Of Scotland. Some years ago church attendances were high, but more recently due to a steady decline in attendance the churches of Kennethmont and Gartly were merged under one minister. In the Spring of 1985 due to further falls in attendance Kennethmont, Gartly, Clatt and Rhynie parishes were merged to form one new parish of "Noth". All four church buildings are used at present but services are only held once a fortnight in each church; Clatt and Rhynie one Sunday, Kennethmont and Gartly the next. A new manse is to be built in Kennethmont. The majority of the population do not attend church regularly,if at all. Religion seems to be less relevant to people nowadays.
